    • Method Detail

      • createUser

        public void createUser(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String birthday,
                       java.lang.String address_detail,
                       java.lang.String city,
                       java.lang.String country)
        This method is used for creating a new user. It does NOT contain validations, so before calling this, validate the user's input as it directly inserts into database. This method also adds the "USER" role for the newly created user and adds it to the in-memory context of Spring Security.

      • decode

        private java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String text)
        Parameters:
        text - the text to decode
        Returns:
        the decoded text

      • encode

        private java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String text)
        Parameters:
        text - the text to encode
        Returns:
        the encoded text

      • getLoggedInUserName

        public java.lang.String getLoggedInUserName()
        This method is used for returning the username of the current logged in user, using the in-memory context of Spring Security.
        Returns:
        the username of the current logged in user

      • getUserCardInfo

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getUserCardInfo()
        This method is used for getting card details of the logged in user from the database.
        Returns:
        HashMap containing HIGH RISK DECRYPTED information of the current logged in user: card number, card expiry date, card cvv/cvc and cardholder's name

      • getUserId

        public java.lang.String getUserId()
        Returns:
        String containing the id of the current logged in user from the database.

      • getUserInfo

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getUserInfo()
        This method is used for getting personal details of the logged in user from the database.
        Returns:
        HashMap containing the name, birthday, address details, city and country of the logged in user

      • isPasswordCorrect

        public boolean isPasswordCorrect(java.lang.String password)
        Parameters:
        password - the password to check for match
        Returns:
        boolean stating whether or not the password is inserted correctly

      • isUserAdmin

        public boolean isUserAdmin()
        This method uses the in-memory context of Spring Security to check if the current user has the "ADMIN" role.
        Returns:
        boolean stating wether the current logged in user is an admin

      • isUsernameTaken

        public boolean isUsernameTaken(java.lang.String username)
        This method uses the strategy of Spring Security of checking whether or not the username is already taken.
        Parameters:
        username - the username to check
        Returns:
        boolean stating whether or not the username already exists

      • updateCard

        public void updateCard(java.lang.String card_number,
                       java.lang.String cardholder_name,
                       java.lang.String card_expiry_date,
                       java.lang.String card_cvv)
        This method is used for updating card info of the current logged in user. It does NOT contain validations, so before calling this, validate the user's input as it directly inserts into database.

      • updatePassword

        public void updatePassword(java.lang.String oldPassword,
                           java.lang.String newPassword)
        This method is used for updating the password the current logged in user. It does NOT contain validations, so before calling this, validate the user's input as it directly inserts into database. This method changes the password of the user at database level, buy also at the in-memory user management of Spring Security.

      • updateUserinfo

        public void updateUserinfo(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String birthday,
                           java.lang.String address_detail,
                           java.lang.String city,
                           java.lang.String country)
        This method is used for updating personal info of the current logged in user. It does NOT contain validations, so before calling this, validate the user's input as it directly inserts into database.
